2: At the appointed time I will judge fairly.\q
3:
Though the earth and all the inhabitants shake in fear,\q I make steady the earth's pillars.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
4:
I said to the arrogant, "Do not be arrogant,"\q and to the wicked, "Do not lift up the horn.
\q
5:
Do not lift up your horn to the heights;\q do not speak with an insolent neck."
\q
6:
It is not from the east or from the west,\q and it is not from the wilderness that lifting up comes.


\q
7:
But God is the judge;\q he brings down and he lifts up.
\q
8:
For Yahweh holds in his hand a cup of foaming wine,\q which is mixed with spices, and pours it out.
\q Surely all the wicked of the earth will drink it to the last drop.


\q
9:
But I will continually tell what you have done;\q I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
\q
10: He says, "I will cut off all the horns of the wicked,\q but the horns of the righteous will be raised up."
